alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 10 at 10:31PM EST until March 12 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LATE SEASON SNOW STORM... .Snow will arrive late Friday night across western New Hampshire and the mountains of Maine, possibly becoming heavy on Saturday before ending Saturday evening. The snow will be wet and may mix with rain at times in the lower elevations. Windy conditions will follow late Saturday night and Sunday. Winds will shift to the northwest and gust over 35 mph. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 inches or more possible. Winds could gust as high over 35 mph as the storm exits the region early Sunday morning. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and extremely dangerous travel conditions. Plan on slippery road conditions due to snow covered roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds and the weight of snow on tree limbs may bring down power lines and cause power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
